column4: I tried gnome-shell.....did not like it.....went back to metacity....but now I cannot see desktop icons or right click on desktop.  Have googled but solutions offered do not work.  This on Ubuntu 10.04
tried rm -rf .gnome .gnome2 .gconf .gconfd .metacity  but still......no desktop icons or ability to right click make new folder etc.
I cannot drag and drop anything to the desktops.  Are there nautilus settings I need to restore/reset??
did you install via a ppa?
have you removed gnome-shell?
yes I removed it....but will try again....is the command sudo apt-get remove gnome-shell
apt-cache policy nautilus
and pastebinit
paste the result I mean.:)
ok there isnt a different version from a ppa o whatever..  was gnome-shell from a ppa?
let me find the link i clicked on to install gnome-shell
I used this guid....check out the eye candy section...that is how I installed gnome-shell
what guide
I clicked on a link in this guide http://blog.thesilentnumber.me/2010/04/ubuntu-1004-post-install-guide-what-to.html#eye%20candy that ran apt:gnome-shell
ok, so it wa from standard repository....  thats all I wanted to know.  rm .nautilus -rf and rm .gconf/apps/nautilus -rf and sudo apt-get install --reinstall nautilus and logout/login
do I use alt f2 to exit to terminal then run those commands and do they need sudo in front of them??
only the apt-get needs sudo
thats not a terminal
just ctrl-alt-T and type those commands
yes
rm .nautilus .gconf/apps/nautilus -rf ; sudo apt-get install --reinstall nautilus    (bit tidier)
no good....still cannot right click on desktop, drag or drop anything onto it, and cd drive does not show up
might just be gconf settings then, disabled by gnome-shell.... not sure the exact place to look but have a look in gconf-editor
you can at least enable/disable desktop icons in there, so might be something for whatever else.  Someone else might have more info if they wanna chime in :)
